channel.title: How to prevent non silabs into server?
channel.description:
Hi it's me again. My question is on how do i prevent non silabs to enter the server. I have seen other servers that when the non silabs enter the room it quickly disconnects them.
Can anyone help me on this? Possibly paste a code please.
Thank You

item.title: How to prevent non silabs into server?
item.dc:creator: @ZIAN678 ZIAN678
item.description:
@ZIAN678 wrote:

it just creates moe lagg onto the server for me. I want those who had time in their lives(2 seconds) to download a lil thing a play on my server.

item.title: How to prevent non silabs into server?
item.dc:creator: @kniveslives kniveslives
item.description:
@kniveslives wrote:

Honestly it doesn’t, I get people on my server constantly, they go train even though they can’t see anyone, then they get a 99 stat, a skillcape pops in there inventory, and they disconnect, problem with that is that they just make a new account and keep doing the same thing.

Read full topic
item.source: How to prevent non silabs into server?

item.title: How to prevent non silabs into server?
item.dc:creator: @Java_Is_My_Bitch Java Is My Bitch™
item.description:
@Java_Is_My_Bitch wrote:

You want to keep silab users off your server…?

Declare these ints:

public boolean silabs = false;
public int daUID = 0;

Hopefully you know where to add this: (Run Method)

int UID = inStream.readDWord();
daUID = UID;

Above your welcome message add this:

if (daUID == 82128902) {
silabs = true;
disconnected = true;
}

All silab users will get disconnected.

Not mines btw.

I just read it…
You want to let them on, instead you would put this:

if (daUID == 82128902) {
silabs = true;
sendMessage(“Using Silab Client, Good!”);
} else {
disconnected = true;
}

All other UIDs get disconnected.

Read full topic
item.source: How to prevent non silabs into server?
